Title: Live: Hindenburg allegations against SEBI chief to hit sentiment? Adani shares in focus|Opening Bell
Description: Indian equity market closed one percent higher after a gap-up opening on Friday but failed to sustain above the short-term moving averages (10 and 21-day EMA), which coincides with the 24,400 mark. This is a crucial level to watch for further upside towards 24,700, the upper end of the bearish gap created on August 5. If the index fails to close and sustain above 24,400, consolidation may continue with support at the 24,100-24,000 zone, according to experts. The Nifty 50 finished the week 1.4 percent down at 24,368. This morning GIFT Nifty is hinting at a mildly negative start. Investors will be watching out for any reaction to the Hindenburg allegations against SEBI chief Madhabi Puri Buch and her husband saying that they had stakes in offshore funds used by the Adani group.  Among stocks in focus, watch out for Adani Group stocks, Jubilant Foodworks, Honasa, Bharat Dynamics and Mazagon Dock. Catch Nandita Khemka in conversation with Kunal Rambhia—Fund Manager, The Streets.

Stocks make a solid comeback as global optimism spreads, with Nifty surging over 250 points to briefly reclaim 24,400. While broader markets underperform benchmarks, the NSE advance-decline ratio is almost 3:2, and the India VIX slides nearly 8 percent below 16. All sectors gain, led by Autos, PSU banks, and Realty. Catch Nandita Khemka and Yatin Mota as they discuss stocks on their radar
#stockmarket, #sharemarket #nifty #sensex #marketclosing

Title: Live: Can Nifty defend 25,000 amid global selloff? Ola Electric IPO opens | Opening Bell
Description: Indian equity market opened with a gap-up above the 25,000 milestone. Despite gradually losing momentum, the Nifty50 index concluded the session on a positive note, managing to settle above the 25,000 mark for the first time. However, the market breadth remains restrained, with limited support from the bulls, indicating a sign of timidity. From a technical standpoint, for Nifty, 24,800 remains the crucial support zone, where buying is anticipated to emerge, followed by the sacrosanct support of the 24,600-24,500 zone. On the higher end, as per experts, 25,080-25,100 appears to be an intermediate obstacle. However, this morning global cues are extremely weak with Nasdaq tumbling over 2% overnight and Nikkei clocking deep cuts of ove 5%. The GIFT Nifty is also hinting at a negative start for the Indian market. Among stocks in focus, watch out for Tata Motors, ITC, Eicher, Hero Moto, Titan & Britannia. Meanwhile Ola Electric IPO opens for subscription. Catch Nandita Khemka in conversation with Raja Venkatraman, Co-Founder, NeoTrader

Title: Live: Can nifty defy global cues to conquer 25,000 today? PNB Housing block deal| Opening Bell
Description:
Indian equity market staged a spectacular start to the week, moving closer to the 25,000 mark, but wiped out gains in the second half and closed flat on July 29. The benchmark indices recorded a new closing high, with the Nifty 50 finishing the session at 24,836.10, up 1.25 points. The 24,600-24,500 zone is likely to be a key support area. However, if the index holds 24,800 in the coming sessions amid likely consolidation, then the 25,000-25,200 range is the area to watch on the higher side, experts said. 

Among stocks in focus, watch out for PNB Housing, HPCL, Tata Consumer among others. Meanwhile Akum Drugs IPO opens for subscription today. Catch Nandita Khemka in conversation with Aamar Deo Singh, Sr Vice President, Angel One.

Title: Live: Hindenburg allegations against SEBI chief to hit sentiment? Adani shares in focus|Opening Bell
Description: Indian equity market closed one percent higher after a gap-up opening on Friday but failed to sustain above the short-term moving averages (10 and 21-day EMA), which coincides with the 24,400 mark. This is a crucial level to watch for further upside towards 24,700, the upper end of the bearish gap created on August 5. If the index fails to close and sustain above 24,400, consolidation may continue with support at the 24,100-24,000 zone, according to experts. The Nifty 50 finished the week 1.4 percent down at 24,368. This morning GIFT Nifty is hinting at a mildly negative start. Investors will be watching out for any reaction to the Hindenburg allegations against SEBI chief Madhabi Puri Buch and her husband saying that they had stakes in offshore funds used by the Adani group.  Among stocks in focus, watch out for Adani Group stocks, Jubilant Foodworks, Honasa, Bharat Dynamics and Mazagon Dock. Catch Nandita Khemka in conversation with Kunal Rambhia—Fund Manager, The Streets.

Title: Live: Can Nifty defend 25,000 amid global selloff? Ola Electric IPO opens | Opening Bell
Description: Indian equity market opened with a gap-up above the 25,000 milestone. Despite gradually losing momentum, the Nifty50 index concluded the session on a positive note, managing to settle above the 25,000 mark for the first time. However, the market breadth remains restrained, with limited support from the bulls, indicating a sign of timidity. From a technical standpoint, for Nifty, 24,800 remains the crucial support zone, where buying is anticipated to emerge, followed by the sacrosanct support of the 24,600-24,500 zone. On the higher end, as per experts, 25,080-25,100 appears to be an intermediate obstacle. However, this morning global cues are extremely weak with Nasdaq tumbling over 2% overnight and Nikkei clocking deep cuts of ove 5%. The GIFT Nifty is also hinting at a negative start for the Indian market. Among stocks in focus, watch out for Tata Motors, ITC, Eicher, Hero Moto, Titan & Britannia. Meanwhile Ola Electric IPO opens for subscription. Catch Nandita Khemka in conversation with Raja Venkatraman, Co-Founder, NeoTrader

Title: Live: Can nifty defy global cues to conquer 25,000 today? PNB Housing block deal| Opening Bell
Description:
Indian equity market staged a spectacular start to the week, moving closer to the 25,000 mark, but wiped out gains in the second half and closed flat on July 29. The benchmark indices recorded a new closing high, with the Nifty 50 finishing the session at 24,836.10, up 1.25 points. The 24,600-24,500 zone is likely to be a key support area. However, if the index holds 24,800 in the coming sessions amid likely consolidation, then the 25,000-25,200 range is the area to watch on the higher side, experts said. 

Among stocks in focus, watch out for PNB Housing, HPCL, Tata Consumer among others. Meanwhile Akum Drugs IPO opens for subscription today. Catch Nandita Khemka in conversation with Aamar Deo Singh, Sr Vice President, Angel One.

Title: Live: Hindenburg allegations against SEBI chief to hit sentiment? Adani shares in focus|Opening Bell
Description: Indian equity market closed one percent higher after a gap-up opening on Friday but failed to sustain above the short-term moving averages (10 and 21-day EMA), which coincides with the 24,400 mark. This is a crucial level to watch for further upside towards 24,700, the upper end of the bearish gap created on August 5. If the index fails to close and sustain above 24,400, consolidation may continue with support at the 24,100-24,000 zone, according to experts. The Nifty 50 finished the week 1.4 percent down at 24,368. This morning GIFT Nifty is hinting at a mildly negative start. Investors will be watching out for any reaction to the Hindenburg allegations against SEBI chief Madhabi Puri Buch and her husband saying that they had stakes in offshore funds used by the Adani group.  Among stocks in focus, watch out for Adani Group stocks, Jubilant Foodworks, Honasa, Bharat Dynamics and Mazagon Dock. Catch Nandita Khemka in conversation with Kunal Rambhia—Fund Manager, The Streets.

Title: Live: Can Nifty defend 25,000 amid global selloff? Ola Electric IPO opens | Opening Bell
Description: Indian equity market opened with a gap-up above the 25,000 milestone. Despite gradually losing momentum, the Nifty50 index concluded the session on a positive note, managing to settle above the 25,000 mark for the first time. However, the market breadth remains restrained, with limited support from the bulls, indicating a sign of timidity. From a technical standpoint, for Nifty, 24,800 remains the crucial support zone, where buying is anticipated to emerge, followed by the sacrosanct support of the 24,600-24,500 zone. On the higher end, as per experts, 25,080-25,100 appears to be an intermediate obstacle. However, this morning global cues are extremely weak with Nasdaq tumbling over 2% overnight and Nikkei clocking deep cuts of ove 5%. The GIFT Nifty is also hinting at a negative start for the Indian market. Among stocks in focus, watch out for Tata Motors, ITC, Eicher, Hero Moto, Titan & Britannia. Meanwhile Ola Electric IPO opens for subscription. Catch Nandita Khemka in conversation with Raja Venkatraman, Co-Founder, NeoTrader

Title: Live: Can nifty defy global cues to conquer 25,000 today? PNB Housing block deal| Opening Bell
Description:
Indian equity market staged a spectacular start to the week, moving closer to the 25,000 mark, but wiped out gains in the second half and closed flat on July 29. The benchmark indices recorded a new closing high, with the Nifty 50 finishing the session at 24,836.10, up 1.25 points. The 24,600-24,500 zone is likely to be a key support area. However, if the index holds 24,800 in the coming sessions amid likely consolidation, then the 25,000-25,200 range is the area to watch on the higher side, experts said. 

Among stocks in focus, watch out for PNB Housing, HPCL, Tata Consumer among others. Meanwhile Akum Drugs IPO opens for subscription today. Catch Nandita Khemka in conversation with Aamar Deo Singh, Sr Vice President, Angel One.

Title: Live: Hindenburg allegations against SEBI chief to hit sentiment? Adani shares in focus|Opening Bell
Description: Indian equity market closed one percent higher after a gap-up opening on Friday but failed to sustain above the short-term moving averages (10 and 21-day EMA), which coincides with the 24,400 mark. This is a crucial level to watch for further upside towards 24,700, the upper end of the bearish gap created on August 5. If the index fails to close and sustain above 24,400, consolidation may continue with support at the 24,100-24,000 zone, according to experts. The Nifty 50 finished the week 1.4 percent down at 24,368. This morning GIFT Nifty is hinting at a mildly negative start. Investors will be watching out for any reaction to the Hindenburg allegations against SEBI chief Madhabi Puri Buch and her husband saying that they had stakes in offshore funds used by the Adani group.  Among stocks in focus, watch out for Adani Group stocks, Jubilant Foodworks, Honasa, Bharat Dynamics and Mazagon Dock. Catch Nandita Khemka in conversation with Kunal Rambhia—Fund Manager, The Streets.

Title: Live: Can Nifty defend 25,000 amid global selloff? Ola Electric IPO opens | Opening Bell

Despite gradually losing momentum, the Nifty50 index concluded the session on a positive note, managing to settle above the 25,000 mark for the first time. However, the market breadth remains restrained, with limited support from the bulls, indicating a sign of timidity. From a technical standpoint, for Nifty, 24,800 remains the crucial support zone, where buying is anticipated to emerge, followed by the sacrosanct support of the 24,600-24,500 zone. On the higher end, as per experts, 25,080-25,100 appears to be an intermediate obstacle. However, this morning global cues are extremely weak with Nasdaq tumbling over 2% overnight and Nikkei clocking deep cuts of ove 5%. The GIFT Nifty is also hinting at a negative start for the Indian market. Among stocks in focus, watch out for Tata Motors, ITC, Eicher, Hero Moto, Titan & Britannia. Meanwhile Ola Electric IPO opens for subscription. Catch Nandita Khemka in conversation with Raja Venkatraman, Co-Founder, NeoTrader

Title: Nifty hits 25,000 milestone for the first time, autos, Dabur in focus | Closing Bell
Description: Nifty scales 25,000 in third-fastest 1,000-point rally on record. Latest 1,000-point rally has taken 24 trading sessions. Nifty is now up nearly 4,000 points from the June 4 low. Top contributors to 1000-pt rally - Infosys, HCLTech & ITC. ONGC, HDFC Life and SBI Life top gainers in this 1000-pt rally. Join Yatin Mota and Nandita Khemka as they dive into the key stocks currently on their radar.

Title: Live: Hindenburg allegations against SEBI chief to hit sentiment? Adani shares in focus|Opening Bell
Description: Indian equity market closed one percent higher after a gap-up opening on Friday but failed to sustain above the short-term moving averages (10 and 21-day EMA), which coincides with the 24,400 mark. This is a crucial level to watch for further upside towards 24,700, the upper end of the bearish gap created on August 5. If the index fails to close and sustain above 24,400, consolidation may continue with support at the 24,100-24,000 zone, according to experts. The Nifty 50 finished the week 1.4 percent down at 24,368. This morning GIFT Nifty is hinting at a mildly negative start. Investors will be watching out for any reaction to the Hindenburg allegations against SEBI chief Madhabi Puri Buch and her husband saying that they had stakes in offshore funds used by the Adani group.  Among stocks in focus, watch out for Adani Group stocks, Jubilant Foodworks, Honasa, Bharat Dynamics and Mazagon Dock. Catch Nandita Khemka in conversation with Kunal Rambhia—Fund Manager, The Streets.

Title: Live: Can Nifty defend 25,000 amid global selloff? Ola Electric IPO opens | Opening Bell
Description: Indian equity market opened with a gap-up above the 25,000 milestone. Despite gradually losing momentum, the Nifty50 index concluded the session on a positive note, managing to settle above the 25,000 mark for the first time. However, the market breadth remains restrained, with limited support from the bulls, indicating a sign of timidity. From a technical standpoint, for Nifty, 24,800 remains the crucial support zone, where buying is anticipated to emerge, followed by the sacrosanct support of the 24,600-24,500 zone. On the higher end, as per experts, 25,080-25,100 appears to be an intermediate obstacle. However, this morning global cues are extremely weak with Nasdaq tumbling over 2% overnight and Nikkei clocking deep cuts of ove 5%. The GIFT Nifty is also hinting at a negative start for the Indian market. Among stocks in focus, watch out for Tata Motors, ITC, Eicher, Hero Moto, Titan & Britannia. Meanwhile Ola Electric IPO opens for subscription. Catch Nandita Khemka in conversation with Raja Venkatraman, Co-Founder, NeoTrader

Title: Live: Will Nifty extend upward journey towards 24,700? | In Focus: PSBs, Zomato | Opening Bell

Conversely, a close below 24,100 could signal a bearish breakdown. So, a 'buy on dips" could hold upon till 24,100 levels. On the global front, the market may see some consolidation with a positive bias, with focus on the FOMC minutes, the Fed chair speech in Jackson Hole, and global trends. As for stocks specific action,  GMR Airports Infrastructure, Kolte-Patil Developers and Escorts Kubota will be in focus on Monday. Title: Live: Hindenburg allegations against SEBI chief to hit sentiment? Adani shares in focus|Opening Bell
Description: Indian equity market closed one percent higher after a gap-up opening on Friday but failed to sustain above the short-term moving averages (10 and 21-day EMA), which coincides with the 24,400 mark. This is a crucial level to watch for further upside towards 24,700, the upper end of the bearish gap created on August 5. If the index fails to close and sustain above 24,400, consolidation may continue with support at the 24,100-24,000 zone, according to experts. The Nifty 50 finished the week 1.4 percent down at 24,368. This morning GIFT Nifty is hinting at a mildly negative start. Investors will be watching out for any reaction to the Hindenburg allegations against SEBI chief Madhabi Puri Buch and her husband saying that they had stakes in offshore funds used by the Adani group.  Among stocks in focus, watch out for Adani Group stocks, Jubilant Foodworks, Honasa, Bharat Dynamics and Mazagon Dock. Catch Nandita Khemka in conversation with Kunal Rambhia—Fund Manager, The Streets.

Title: Live: Can Nifty defend 25,000 amid global selloff? Ola Electric IPO opens | Opening Bell
Description: Indian equity market opened with a gap-up above the 25,000 milestone. Despite gradually losing momentum, the Nifty50 index concluded the session on a positive note, managing to settle above the 25,000 mark for the first time. However, the market breadth remains restrained, with limited support from the bulls, indicating a sign of timidity. From a technical standpoint, for Nifty, 24,800 remains the crucial support zone, where buying is anticipated to emerge, followed by the sacrosanct support of the 24,600-24,500 zone. On the higher end, as per experts, 25,080-25,100 appears to be an intermediate obstacle. However, this morning global cues are extremely weak with Nasdaq tumbling over 2% overnight and Nikkei clocking deep cuts of ove 5%. The GIFT Nifty is also hinting at a negative start for the Indian market. Among stocks in focus, watch out for Tata Motors, ITC, Eicher, Hero Moto, Titan & Britannia. Meanwhile Ola Electric IPO opens for subscription. Catch Nandita Khemka in conversation with Raja Venkatraman, Co-Founder, NeoTrader

Title: Live: Will Nifty extend upward journey towards 24,700? | In Focus: PSBs, Zomato | Opening Bell
Description: After several days of consolidation, the Nifty-50 recorded a strong rally on August 16 closing above 24,500 levels.From a technical perspective, the index now appears poised to test the 24,700 and 25,000 levels in this week, as these are key resistance zones that need to be breached. Conversely, a close below 24,100 could signal a bearish breakdown. So, a 'buy on dips" could hold upon till 24,100 levels. On the global front, the market may see some consolidation with a positive bias, with focus on the FOMC minutes, the Fed chair speech in Jackson Hole, and global trends. As for stocks specific action,  GMR Airports Infrastructure, Kolte-Patil Developers and Escorts Kubota will be in focus on Monday. Title: Live: Hindenburg allegations against SEBI chief to hit sentiment? Adani shares in focus|Opening Bell
Description: Indian equity market closed one percent higher after a gap-up opening on Friday but failed to sustain above the short-term moving averages (10 and 21-day EMA), which coincides with the 24,400 mark. This is a crucial level to watch for further upside towards 24,700, the upper end of the bearish gap created on August 5. If the index fails to close and sustain above 24,400, consolidation may continue with support at the 24,100-24,000 zone, according to experts. The Nifty 50 finished the week 1.4 percent down at 24,368. This morning GIFT Nifty is hinting at a mildly negative start. Investors will be watching out for any reaction to the Hindenburg allegations against SEBI chief Madhabi Puri Buch and her husband saying that they had stakes in offshore funds used by the Adani group.  Among stocks in focus, watch out for Adani Group stocks, Jubilant Foodworks, Honasa, Bharat Dynamics and Mazagon Dock. Catch Nandita Khemka in conversation with Kunal Rambhia—Fund Manager, The Streets.

Title: Live: Can Nifty defend 25,000 amid global selloff? Ola Electric IPO opens | Opening Bell
Description: Indian equity market opened with a gap-up above the 25,000 milestone. Despite gradually losing momentum, the Nifty50 index concluded the session on a positive note, managing to settle above the 25,000 mark for the first time. However, the market breadth remains restrained, with limited support from the bulls, indicating a sign of timidity. From a technical standpoint, for Nifty, 24,800 remains the crucial support zone, where buying is anticipated to emerge, followed by the sacrosanct support of the 24,600-24,500 zone. On the higher end, as per experts, 25,080-25,100 appears to be an intermediate obstacle. However, this morning global cues are extremely weak with Nasdaq tumbling over 2% overnight and Nikkei clocking deep cuts of ove 5%. The GIFT Nifty is also hinting at a negative start for the Indian market. Among stocks in focus, watch out for Tata Motors, ITC, Eicher, Hero Moto, Titan & Britannia. Meanwhile Ola Electric IPO opens for subscription. Catch Nandita Khemka in conversation with Raja Venkatraman, Co-Founder, NeoTrader

Across the globe, on Wall street, indices snapped their gaining streak to put a pause to the recovery rally. Asian markets too are trading lower on Wednesday morning. Title: Live: Hindenburg allegations against SEBI chief to hit sentiment? Adani shares in focus|Opening Bell
Description: Indian equity market closed one percent higher after a gap-up opening on Friday but failed to sustain above the short-term moving averages (10 and 21-day EMA), which coincides with the 24,400 mark. This is a crucial level to watch for further upside towards 24,700, the upper end of the bearish gap created on August 5. If the index fails to close and sustain above 24,400, consolidation may continue with support at the 24,100-24,000 zone, according to experts. The Nifty 50 finished the week 1.4 percent down at 24,368. This morning GIFT Nifty is hinting at a mildly negative start. Investors will be watching out for any reaction to the Hindenburg allegations against SEBI chief Madhabi Puri Buch and her husband saying that they had stakes in offshore funds used by the Adani group.  Among stocks in focus, watch out for Adani Group stocks, Jubilant Foodworks, Honasa, Bharat Dynamics and Mazagon Dock. Catch Nandita Khemka in conversation with Kunal Rambhia—Fund Manager, The Streets.

Title: Live: Can Nifty defend 25,000 amid global selloff? Ola Electric IPO opens | Opening Bell
Description: Indian equity market opened with a gap-up above the 25,000 milestone. Despite gradually losing momentum, the Nifty50 index concluded the session on a positive note, managing to settle above the 25,000 mark for the first time. However, the market breadth remains restrained, with limited support from the bulls, indicating a sign of timidity. From a technical standpoint, for Nifty, 24,800 remains the crucial support zone, where buying is anticipated to emerge, followed by the sacrosanct support of the 24,600-24,500 zone. On the higher end, as per experts, 25,080-25,100 appears to be an intermediate obstacle. However, this morning global cues are extremely weak with Nasdaq tumbling over 2% overnight and Nikkei clocking deep cuts of ove 5%. The GIFT Nifty is also hinting at a negative start for the Indian market. Among stocks in focus, watch out for Tata Motors, ITC, Eicher, Hero Moto, Titan & Britannia. Meanwhile Ola Electric IPO opens for subscription. Catch Nandita Khemka in conversation with Raja Venkatraman, Co-Founder, NeoTrader

Title: Live: Will Nifty extend upward journey towards 24,700? | In Focus: PSBs, Zomato | Opening Bell

Conversely, a close below 24,100 could signal a bearish breakdown. So, a 'buy on dips" could hold upon till 24,100 levels. On the global front, the market may see some consolidation with a positive bias, with focus on the FOMC minutes, the Fed chair speech in Jackson Hole, and global trends. As for stocks specific action,  GMR Airports Infrastructure, Kolte-Patil Developers and Escorts Kubota will be in focus on Monday. Title: Live: Hindenburg allegations against SEBI chief to hit sentiment? Adani shares in focus|Opening Bell
Description: Indian equity market closed one percent higher after a gap-up opening on Friday but failed to sustain above the short-term moving averages (10 and 21-day EMA), which coincides with the 24,400 mark. This is a crucial level to watch for further upside towards 24,700, the upper end of the bearish gap created on August 5. If the index fails to close and sustain above 24,400, consolidation may continue with support at the 24,100-24,000 zone, according to experts. The Nifty 50 finished the week 1.4 percent down at 24,368. This morning GIFT Nifty is hinting at a mildly negative start. Investors will be watching out for any reaction to the Hindenburg allegations against SEBI chief Madhabi Puri Buch and her husband saying that they had stakes in offshore funds used by the Adani group.  Among stocks in focus, watch out for Adani Group stocks, Jubilant Foodworks, Honasa, Bharat Dynamics and Mazagon Dock. Catch Nandita Khemka in conversation with Kunal Rambhia—Fund Manager, The Streets.

Title: Live: Hindenburg allegations against SEBI chief to hit sentiment? Adani shares in focus|Opening Bell
Description: Indian equity market closed one percent higher after a gap-up opening on Friday but failed to sustain above the short-term moving averages (10 and 21-day EMA), which coincides with the 24,400 mark. This is a crucial level to watch for further upside towards 24,700, the upper end of the bearish gap created on August 5. If the index fails to close and sustain above 24,400, consolidation may continue with support at the 24,100-24,000 zone, according to experts. The Nifty 50 finished the week 1.4 percent down at 24,368. This morning GIFT Nifty is hinting at a mildly negative start. Investors will be watching out for any reaction to the Hindenburg allegations against SEBI chief Madhabi Puri Buch and her husband saying that they had stakes in offshore funds used by the Adani group.  Among stocks in focus, watch out for Adani Group stocks, Jubilant Foodworks, Honasa, Bharat Dynamics and Mazagon Dock. Catch Nandita Khemka in conversation with Kunal Rambhia—Fund Manager, The Streets.

Title: Live: Hindenburg allegations against SEBI chief to hit sentiment? Adani shares in focus|Opening Bell
Description: Indian equity market closed one percent higher after a gap-up opening on Friday but failed to sustain above the short-term moving averages (10 and 21-day EMA), which coincides with the 24,400 mark. This is a crucial level to watch for further upside towards 24,700, the upper end of the bearish gap created on August 5. If the index fails to close and sustain above 24,400, consolidation may continue with support at the 24,100-24,000 zone, according to experts. The Nifty 50 finished the week 1.4 percent down at 24,368. This morning GIFT Nifty is hinting at a mildly negative start. Investors will be watching out for any reaction to the Hindenburg allegations against SEBI chief Madhabi Puri Buch and her husband saying that they had stakes in offshore funds used by the Adani group.  Among stocks in focus, watch out for Adani Group stocks, Jubilant Foodworks, Honasa, Bharat Dynamics and Mazagon Dock. Catch Nandita Khemka in conversation with Kunal Rambhia—Fund Manager, The Streets.

Title: Live: Indian equity market poised for further upside? | In Focus: Zomato, Bajaj Auto | Opening Bell
Description: With the lack of positive trigger, Nifty managed to close in the green however shutting shop below the 24,600 levels.As long as the Nifty 50 sustains above the 24,500-24,550 area, a march towards the 24,700-24,800 zone is likely amid consolidation in the coming sessions, while the 24,400-24,300 range is expected to act as a support area. Among stocks in focus will be Zomato on back of reports of a block deal. IndusInd Bank as it gets approval for a Mutual Fund arm and Bajaj Auto which says it will take a hit in its bottom line of Rs 211 cr due to the indexation benefit withdrawal. Title: Live: Will Nifty extend upward journey towards 24,700? | In Focus: PSBs, Zomato | Opening Bell
Description: After several days of consolidation, the Nifty-50 recorded a strong rally on August 16 closing above 24,500 levels.From a technical perspective, the index now appears poised to test the 24,700 and 25,000 levels in this week, as these are key resistance zones that need to be breached. Conversely, a close below 24,100 could signal a bearish breakdown. So, a 'buy on dips" could hold upon till 24,100 levels. On the global front, the market may see some consolidation with a positive bias, with focus on the FOMC minutes, the Fed chair speech in Jackson Hole, and global trends. As for stocks specific action,  GMR Airports Infrastructure, Kolte-Patil Developers and Escorts Kubota will be in focus on Monday. Title: Live: Hindenburg allegations against SEBI chief to hit sentiment? Adani shares in focus|Opening Bell
Description: Indian equity market closed one percent higher after a gap-up opening on Friday but failed to sustain above the short-term moving averages (10 and 21-day EMA), which coincides with the 24,400 mark. This is a crucial level to watch for further upside towards 24,700, the upper end of the bearish gap created on August 5. If the index fails to close and sustain above 24,400, consolidation may continue with support at the 24,100-24,000 zone, according to experts. The Nifty 50 finished the week 1.4 percent down at 24,368. This morning GIFT Nifty is hinting at a mildly negative start. Investors will be watching out for any reaction to the Hindenburg allegations against SEBI chief Madhabi Puri Buch and her husband saying that they had stakes in offshore funds used by the Adani group.  Among stocks in focus, watch out for Adani Group stocks, Jubilant Foodworks, Honasa, Bharat Dynamics and Mazagon Dock. Catch Nandita Khemka in conversation with Kunal Rambhia—Fund Manager, The Streets.

Description: Benchmark indices S&P Sensex and Nifty 50 had maintained their lead on Monday at elevated levels, after US Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell's speech signalled the interest rate cut cycle could begin from the upcoming Federal Reserve meeting scheduled for September.  Around 2:00 PM, the S&P Sensex was at 81,746, up 0.81 per cent or 650 points, while the Nifty 50 was at 25,017 levels, up 0.78 per cent or 194 points. Major share markets acorss Asia-Pacific turned hesitant on Monday, while the dollar and bond yields sagged ahead of inflation data that could pave the way for rate cuts in the United States and Europe, while Wall Street braced for earnings from AI darling Nvidia.

Title: Can Market Extend its Gaining Streak for 8-Days? | In Focus: ONGC, BEL | Opening Bell
Description: Will Nifty aim to make fresh all time highs again? On Friday, the Nifty 50 closed at 24,823, rising 12 points, while Sensex shut shop above 81000 levels. According to experts, if the index sustains above this level, the 24,950-25,000 zone is the next area to watch in the coming sessions, with potential intermittent consolidation. The Bank Nifty is likely to inch towards the 51,500 area, with support at the 50,700-50,800 zone. Feds dovish commentary has cheered investors on Wall Street and that is sure to have a ripple effect on stocks markets globally. The gift nifty is signally a positive start for Indian equity markets. Among stocks in focus will be ONGC, TCI on news flow while, BEL Trent will be included into Nifty 50 by end of September. Moneycontrol's Stacy Pereira speaks with Raja Ajit Mishra - SVP, Research, Religare Broking Ltd about all this and more on Opening Bell

Title: Live: Can Market Sustain The Positive Momentum? In Focus: Tata Stocks, Cyient DLM | Opening Bell

If the index manages to defend 24,650 and consolidates around the same level, a further march towards 24,800-24,900 is likely in the coming sessions, with 24,500 acting as a support area. Across the globe, on Wall street, indices snapped their gaining streak to put a pause to the recovery rally. Asian markets too are trading lower on Wednesday morning. Among stock specific action look out for block deals in Cyient DLM and PNB Housing Finance. There is good news for TataMotors & Tata Steel S&P Global has raised its ratings to investment grade, it also changed its outlook to stable from watch positive. Conversely, a close below 24,100 could signal a bearish breakdown. So, a 'buy on dips" could hold upon till 24,100 levels. On the global front, the market may see some consolidation with a positive bias, with focus on the FOMC minutes, the Fed chair speech in Jackson Hole, and global trends. As for stocks specific action,  GMR Airports Infrastructure, Kolte-Patil Developers and Escorts Kubota will be in focus on Monday. Title: Live: Hindenburg allegations against SEBI chief to hit sentiment? Adani shares in focus|Opening Bell
Description: Indian equity market closed one percent higher after a gap-up opening on Friday but failed to sustain above the short-term moving averages (10 and 21-day EMA), which coincides with the 24,400 mark. This is a crucial level to watch for further upside towards 24,700, the upper end of the bearish gap created on August 5. If the index fails to close and sustain above 24,400, consolidation may continue with support at the 24,100-24,000 zone, according to experts. The Nifty 50 finished the week 1.4 percent down at 24,368. This morning GIFT Nifty is hinting at a mildly negative start. Investors will be watching out for any reaction to the Hindenburg allegations against SEBI chief Madhabi Puri Buch and her husband saying that they had stakes in offshore funds used by the Adani group.  Among stocks in focus, watch out for Adani Group stocks, Jubilant Foodworks, Honasa, Bharat Dynamics and Mazagon Dock. Catch Nandita Khemka in conversation with Kunal Rambhia—Fund Manager, The Streets.

Feds dovish commentary has cheered investors on Wall Street and that is sure to have a ripple effect on stocks markets globally. The gift nifty is signally a positive start for Indian equity markets. Among stocks in focus will be ONGC, TCI on news flow while, BEL Trent will be included into Nifty 50 by end of September. Title: Live: Will Nifty extend upward journey towards 24,700? | In Focus: PSBs, Zomato | Opening Bell

Conversely, a close below 24,100 could signal a bearish breakdown. So, a 'buy on dips" could hold upon till 24,100 levels. On the global front, the market may see some consolidation with a positive bias, with focus on the FOMC minutes, the Fed chair speech in Jackson Hole, and global trends. As for stocks specific action,  GMR Airports Infrastructure, Kolte-Patil Developers and Escorts Kubota will be in focus on Monday. Title: Live: Hindenburg allegations against SEBI chief to hit sentiment? Adani shares in focus|Opening Bell
Description: Indian equity market closed one percent higher after a gap-up opening on Friday but failed to sustain above the short-term moving averages (10 and 21-day EMA), which coincides with the 24,400 mark. This is a crucial level to watch for further upside towards 24,700, the upper end of the bearish gap created on August 5. If the index fails to close and sustain above 24,400, consolidation may continue with support at the 24,100-24,000 zone, according to experts. The Nifty 50 finished the week 1.4 percent down at 24,368. This morning GIFT Nifty is hinting at a mildly negative start. Investors will be watching out for any reaction to the Hindenburg allegations against SEBI chief Madhabi Puri Buch and her husband saying that they had stakes in offshore funds used by the Adani group.  Among stocks in focus, watch out for Adani Group stocks, Jubilant Foodworks, Honasa, Bharat Dynamics and Mazagon Dock. Catch Nandita Khemka in conversation with Kunal Rambhia—Fund Manager, The Streets.

Conversely, a close below 24,100 could signal a bearish breakdown. So, a 'buy on dips" could hold upon till 24,100 levels. On the global front, the market may see some consolidation with a positive bias, with focus on the FOMC minutes, the Fed chair speech in Jackson Hole, and global trends. As for stocks specific action,  GMR Airports Infrastructure, Kolte-Patil Developers and Escorts Kubota will be in focus on Monday. Title: Live: Hindenburg allegations against SEBI chief to hit sentiment? Adani shares in focus|Opening Bell
Description: Indian equity market closed one percent higher after a gap-up opening on Friday but failed to sustain above the short-term moving averages (10 and 21-day EMA), which coincides with the 24,400 mark. This is a crucial level to watch for further upside towards 24,700, the upper end of the bearish gap created on August 5. If the index fails to close and sustain above 24,400, consolidation may continue with support at the 24,100-24,000 zone, according to experts. The Nifty 50 finished the week 1.4 percent down at 24,368. This morning GIFT Nifty is hinting at a mildly negative start. Investors will be watching out for any reaction to the Hindenburg allegations against SEBI chief Madhabi Puri Buch and her husband saying that they had stakes in offshore funds used by the Adani group.  Among stocks in focus, watch out for Adani Group stocks, Jubilant Foodworks, Honasa, Bharat Dynamics and Mazagon Dock. Catch Nandita Khemka in conversation with Kunal Rambhia—Fund Manager, The Streets.

According to experts, if the index sustains above this level, the 24,950-25,000 zone is the next area to watch in the coming sessions, with potential intermittent consolidation. The Bank Nifty is likely to inch towards the 51,500 area, with support at the 50,700-50,800 zone. Feds dovish commentary has cheered investors on Wall Street and that is sure to have a ripple effect on stocks markets globally. The gift nifty is signally a positive start for Indian equity markets. Among stocks in focus will be ONGC, TCI on news flow while, BEL Trent will be included into Nifty 50 by end of September. Title: Live: Can Market Sustain The Positive Momentum? In Focus: Tata Stocks, Cyient DLM | Opening Bell
Description: After four consecutive sessions in the green, Nifty 50 finally managed to regain 24,700 levels whereas Sensex to rose to 80,800 levels. If the index manages to defend 24,650 and consolidates around the same level, a further march towards 24,800-24,900 is likely in the coming sessions, with 24,500 acting as a support area. Across the globe, on Wall street, indices snapped their gaining streak to put a pause to the recovery rally. Asian markets too are trading lower on Wednesday morning. Among stock specific action look out for block deals in Cyient DLM and PNB Housing Finance. There is good news for TataMotors & Tata Steel S&P Global has raised its ratings to investment grade, it also changed its outlook to stable from watch positive. Title: Live: Hindenburg allegations against SEBI chief to hit sentiment? Adani shares in focus|Opening Bell
Description: Indian equity market closed one percent higher after a gap-up opening on Friday but failed to sustain above the short-term moving averages (10 and 21-day EMA), which coincides with the 24,400 mark. This is a crucial level to watch for further upside towards 24,700, the upper end of the bearish gap created on August 5. If the index fails to close and sustain above 24,400, consolidation may continue with support at the 24,100-24,000 zone, according to experts. The Nifty 50 finished the week 1.4 percent down at 24,368. This morning GIFT Nifty is hinting at a mildly negative start. Investors will be watching out for any reaction to the Hindenburg allegations against SEBI chief Madhabi Puri Buch and her husband saying that they had stakes in offshore funds used by the Adani group.  Among stocks in focus, watch out for Adani Group stocks, Jubilant Foodworks, Honasa, Bharat Dynamics and Mazagon Dock. Catch Nandita Khemka in conversation with Kunal Rambhia—Fund Manager, The Streets.

Title: Live: Can Market Sustain The Positive Momentum? In Focus: Tata Stocks, Cyient DLM | Opening Bell

Across the globe, on Wall street, indices snapped their gaining streak to put a pause to the recovery rally. Asian markets too are trading lower on Wednesday morning. Among stock specific action look out for block deals in Cyient DLM and PNB Housing Finance. Title: Live: Hindenburg allegations against SEBI chief to hit sentiment? Adani shares in focus|Opening Bell
Description: Indian equity market closed one percent higher after a gap-up opening on Friday but failed to sustain above the short-term moving averages (10 and 21-day EMA), which coincides with the 24,400 mark. This is a crucial level to watch for further upside towards 24,700, the upper end of the bearish gap created on August 5. If the index fails to close and sustain above 24,400, consolidation may continue with support at the 24,100-24,000 zone, according to experts. The Nifty 50 finished the week 1.4 percent down at 24,368. This morning GIFT Nifty is hinting at a mildly negative start. Investors will be watching out for any reaction to the Hindenburg allegations against SEBI chief Madhabi Puri Buch and her husband saying that they had stakes in offshore funds used by the Adani group.  Among stocks in focus, watch out for Adani Group stocks, Jubilant Foodworks, Honasa, Bharat Dynamics and Mazagon Dock. Catch Nandita Khemka in conversation with Kunal Rambhia—Fund Manager, The Streets.
